meanings.definition: To wear out or damage by excessive use.
meanings.sent1: She overwears her favorite shoes by wearing them every day.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't overwear this sweater, I want it to last a long time.
meanings.sent3: He tends to overwear his welcome by staying too long at parties.
meanings.sent4: The constant stress can overwear a person's mental health.
meanings.sent5: The rough handling will overwear the delicate fabric quickly.

meanings.definition: The act of wearing out or damaging by excessive use.
meanings.sent1: The overwear of the carpet was evident in the frayed edges.
meanings.sent2: The overwear on the tires made them unsafe to drive on.
meanings.sent3: The overwear on the playground equipment made it unsafe for children to use.
meanings.sent4: The overwear of the book showed in the faded cover and torn pages.
meanings.sent5: The overwear of the tools made them less effective in completing the job.
